name: dwight barnhart
text:
Run away.   For a traffic ticket they wanted $250 to sign you up for defensive driving.   Call the court.  They will do it for free.   They prey on people that want to clear their driving records.  So sorry people have to deal with this.  Alabama bar association should have hundreds of complaints against these people.

At least they will have one after today!!!   Along with the states attorney general.

Mr Kreps.   Thank you for your response.  And yes. We have both been able to generate public records at this along.  I won’t go to low and degrading levels implying that you have mental issues as you have done so.  I can see how your law firm works first and and responds to complaints by trying to belittle them on a public forum.  Is t it nice to be able to take pics of your responses off records before you edit them.

resp.text: We love all of our potential and current clients.  Everyone has the right to post something negative online so this is a safe space for you to vent.  I’ve been doing this for almost 20 years and have seen most everything and dealt with all different types of people.  We tried to reach out to you three times by telephone to figure out what it is that you were upset about but you refuse to answer the phone and actually talk to us.  I guess you are busy working on your complaint to the attorney general’s office and the Alabama State Bar (both of which we welcome you to file by the way - that is your right).  So, let me get this straight - you were visiting Alabama from Texas and you received a speeding ticket. You waited about a month and contacted our law firm to ask for help in handling the ticket.  We responded immediately, gave you the care and concern that you were seeking, went over the process with you and your options.  We quoted you a very reasonable fee and told you what we could do in order to resolve the case.  You told us that was too much and you were going to pay the ticket and move on - obviously that would not be based on our suggestion because we ALWAYS try to avoid a conviction for our clients (and we are a traffic ticket defense law firm... that you contacted for help).  Presumably, before you paid the ticket, you attempted to communicate on your own to try and get the ticket resolved (which every defendant out there has the right to do - only most people would do that first before contacting us but I guess that didn’t occur to you).  You then called us back and were upset because you resolved the ticket on your own…allegedly - after checking, it is clear that no resolution has been entered into the state system.  We love you man - but whatever it is that is troubling you has nothing to do with us - we hope you get whatever it is straightened out.  As for the frivolous complaints you have tried to threaten us with to the Alabama Attorney General’s office and the Alabama State Bar - bring it on.  We fight like hell for ourselves just like we fight like hell for our clients.  And another thing you may want to keep in mind - the goal of resolving a traffic ticket is so that you have no conviction and presumably no public record of it.  But, you sir, have done a great job of creating a public record of it for whatever reason and for the entire world to see.  Best of luck to you.  Joseph C. Kreps

name: Scott Zbaren
text: Kreps was able to get my speeding citation dismissed.  Process was pretty simple. They send you a checklist of what to do prior to the court date, they represent you in court, pay the court costs, and that’s it.  Communication was limited and only conducted when needed.  Cost me more than just paying the citation, but saved me from having points in my license.

name: Butch Pinkston
text:
Complete and utter waste of money.  After spending $500 with these hacks, I’m in a WORSE position than when I started.

The entire operation is run by a para-legal through text messages.  They promise everything but deliver nothing.  Total cookie-cutter law, no interest in actually defending a case.  I expect this kind of lying, duplicitous bull-sh*t from the cops and the government but not the people you pay good money to represent you.

resp.text:
* Thank you so much for your comments about my law firm - we certainly appreciate your comments and your feedback. We always love and enjoy any type of feedback. We ❤️public criticism of our firm because it allows others to see how we handle our business and how we respond and most of all, it causes us to step back and fully analyze a problem or situation to see what happened, where we can improve and it gives us a valuable opportunity to reach out to a client who is clearly hurting and offer support in whatever way we can.
The only issue in reaching out to you is that we do not know who you are and this is the first we have heard of any problem such as the one you describe - unfortunately, we do not currently have and have never had a client by the name of Butch Pinkston.  If I personally have an issue with a business, I usually contact the business directly and try to resolve whatever it is that is going on.  Businesses don’t get to make things up or hide behind fake names on the internet - I am as transparent as it gets and all of my actual clients know this.
*I have been practicing law for 16+ years and have successfully resolved 17,000+ charges for clients over that period of time.  I am a man - through and through - if someone has a problem with me, all they have to do is explain what the issue is and if I have made a mistake, then I am glad to admit the mistake, apologize and fix it.  That is the measure of a man.
Anyone that knows me and that I have helped knows that I am not a hack, a liar or deceitful - far from it.  If only a successful law practice could be run with a paralegal through text messages - but as you would know if we actually represented you, when someone hires us they are able to text us (and our clients LOVE this option), email us, they get a link to schedule an appointment (at a time convenient for the client) to talk with my staff, they also get a link to schedule an appointment (at a time convenient for the client) with an attorney and also, get our direct dial so all they have to do is call us with a question or issue or to schedule a call with anyone that works for me or an attorney (myself included).
* You don’t get to the level we are and have the impeccable reputation across Alabama and the country that I have by “promising everything but delivering nothing.”  Close to 100% of our charges we handle are ultimately dismissed - if that is “cookie-cutter law” then so be it.  Apparently, our clients love having their charges dismissed.  We have the utmost interest in defending cases - our actual clients know this.  Every single time we speak to a potential client or go over case resolutions with our clients, our goal is to develop options with the ultimate goal of having the charge(s) dismissed.  Once we have options on the table, we go over those options and our clients get to decide how to proceed - we don’t force anyone to accept any offer on the table and are always available to continue fighting, take the case to the next level or have a trial.  It is our client’s case and they get to decide.
* Wow - in your review you said, “I expect this kind of lying, duplicitous BS from the cops and the government but not the people you pay good money to represent you.”  Really?  You expect the cops and the government to lie?  What a sad, sad worldview you have - which explains the many false statements you made while hiding behind a fake name.  I practice law to relieve human suffering - period.  No other reason.  I love people - even the people that choose to post random diatribes attacking me on the internet.
*I invite anyone reading this or looking for a lawyer to Google my name (Joseph Kreps) and review the info about me and my law firm and all of the great work that we do throughout the State of Alabama for clients located all over the world.  I stand by my work and the work of everyone who is on my team.   Joseph C. Kreps * Alabama Lawyer * Lover of People * Defender of Human Beings

text: I had an odd situation where out of the blue I was mailed a notice for failure to appear for a traffic violation. text:
Where do I begin? I was arrested for DUI, Open Container, and speeding. I spent 10  hours in jail thinking my life would never be the same again once these charges  permanently stained my record. At first, I figured there was no point in hiring a lawyer  considering the fact that I was caught dead to rights. I was caught speeding. I was  caught with open container. I blew a .11 once I got to the station. What further proof  would they need to charge me with a DUI? How could I possibly get out of that? A  month went by and I still hadn't hired a lawyer. I got to thinking about it and I figured I  would try and find a good DUI attorney to at least provide some good advice before  entering my case single handedly. I then did some research, and happened to stumble  upon Attorney Joseph C Kreps' YouTube videos online that explained what would  happen if I were actually charged with these convictions. They were so enlightening that  I couldn't help but give this guy a call to see if he could help with my case. I gave him a  call & after getting my information & case details; one of the first things his secretary  mentioned was that they may be able to get the sentence reduced to a public  intoxication. I was astounded, thinking there's no way. I was caught dead to rights. I'm  going down. No doubt about it. I then decided to pay the fee and to hire Attorney Joseph  C Kreps' as my DUI Defense Lawyer (not NEAR as high as what I was quoted from  other firms). His very helpful team then guided me through the process of completing a  series of tasks that would help my case. I completed a questionnaire and a few other
simple tasks that would, in fact, turn out to help my case tremendously. A month later, I  was scheduled to arrive in court on a Wednesday. On a Monday afternoon prior to my  court date, I received a phone call that explained to me that I wouldn't need to show up  in court on Wednesday and that there was a high possibility that my case was going to  be dismissed. I was absolutely thrilled. How could this happen? I was caught dead to  rights! Two days later I received a phone call and an email from the firm saying that if I  completed a level two CRO, 20 hours of community service, and paid a $600 fine plus  court costs, that all charges were to be dismissed! My entire future was left in the hands  of Attorney Joseph C Kreps, and I couldn't have put it in a better place. I now have no  DUI charges and no open container charges on my record. I'm telling you from  experience, this man and his firm are the absolute best DUI Defense Firm you could  possibly hire for your case. ­ If you have a DUI pending ­ Stop what you're doing ­ Call  this firm. It will be the best call you've ever made.

name: Brooke Espinosa
text: You are the reason that people don't like to deal with attorneys! The cases were not DISMISSED, they were  NOT PROCESSED.

resp.text:
Brooke:
Thank you so much for removing the false information from your original review.  We don’t want any trouble with you - you know that - but if a review is posted with false information then that is not fair and everyone would agree with that.  We certainly appreciate your comments and your feedback. We always love and enjoy any type of feedback.  We ❤️ public criticism of our firm because it allows others to see how we handle our business and how we respond and most of all, it causes us to step back and fully analyze a problem or situation to see what happened, where we can improve and it gives us a valuable opportunity to reach out to a client who is clearly hurting and offer support in whatever way we can.
We never claim to be perfect and certainly don't want anyone to think that we are perfect.  As you know, Brooke, we did not represent you.  We represented your partner who is going through the immigration process in the United States of America. We take great pride in the knowledge and the experience that we have over the last 15+ years in handling and resolving 13,000+ charges all over the State of Alabama. When I was made aware of these issues, we reached out to you to try to resolve it within hours and on the next business morning 7-18-18.  When we did reach out ASAP, you went on and on and then hung up on us before we could even talk.  We tried to call back to no avail.  I personally tried to call back to no avail.
The first and most important thing that I would like to point out is that BOTH of the actual client’s charges were DISMISSED.  And it wasn’t just a “traffic ticket”.  He had 2 charges one of which was failure to obey police/fireman.  Immigration is a difficult process and who knows how this could have seriously impacted his immigration issues - that process and system is ALWAYS CHANGING as everyone knows… but it shouldn’t impact him now because we got BOTH OF HIS CHARGES DISMISSED 😉!
As to the class that was required of him, we are sorry that his time was taken from him in order to do that - our main concern was and is his immigration status and getting the charges dismissed.  His completing a class while his lawyers worked through issues beyond anyone’s control seems like a small price to pay to continue the long and difficult process of becoming a legal United States 🇺🇸 Citizen.
It is important for anyone reading this to know that we did email you the DISMISSAL disposition of BOTH CHARGES back in March 2018... and heard not a peep out of you until this review surfaced almost 4.5 months later.  It is baffling.  We love deeply and dearly every single one of our clients and their friends and family including your partner and also you, Brooke.  We still love you no matter you might post about us.  This is the truth because our love for our clients and our love and passion for our work and the system is not dependent on how others think or feel about us because we know the truth and our love is our love no matter what - it’s just who we are.
I invite anyone reading this or looking for a lawyer to Google my name (Joseph Kreps) at any time and see all of the great information about me and my law firm and all of the great work that we do throughout the State of Alabama.  I stand by my work and the work of everyone who is on my team.  We love what we do because we love people and we love to help people - it’s why I am alive and why I was put on this earth and called to do this type of work.
Much love to you, Brooke, and your partner.  If you change your mind and desire to speak to me then I am always here and always willing to talk.  If you or any family members need our help again in the future, please let us know as we would be honored to assist and help you with anything that comes up.
Joseph C. Kreps
Alabama Lawyer * Lover of People * Defender of Human Beings

text: YOU HAVE TO HAVE THIS LAWYER. Read the reviews. They are real. Personally, I don't know where I would be without Elizabeth Zwiebel being my divorce lawyer. Elizabeth greeted me with open arms and understanding words. She explained to me how to best proceed. Her rates were very reasonable especially since I had to hire her on the spot for a hearing in 3 days. She was fantastic in the court room.  Her command of the facts and her preparation was absolutely evident. She knew every detail. She used every bit of the information I gave her to win my case. Without her I don't know where I would be - probably without my children. It was very overwhelming. Her retainer was a no brainer. My family helped me but it was worth every penny. My former husband was way too confident which worked on every single nerve in my body. She told me what was going to happen and every single thing she said happened. It was great to see her work. She stopped the other attorney from running all over me. She straightened out each lie. She worked methodically to get the truth out. I highly recommend her and her team. I would not be where I am without her. Elizabeth, I hope you see this. I cannot thank you enough. From the bottom of my heart - THANK YOU.

Elizabeth always kept me informed of the case and offered no promises, but told me exactly what to expect and not what I wanted to hear. Her up front and honest approach kept everything clear and helped relieve stress during this difficult summer. Any time I needed a to call or email a question I had responses within the same day or 24 hours. Roxana, the office manager, was amazing at organizing documents for my case and keeping me informed of absolutely everything.  They are an amazing team!

I would recommend the Zwiebel Law Firm to anyone, especially fathers who are fighting for their children.  She went above and beyond to ensure my side of the story was heard, and she helped bring peace to myself and my family.  I could never thank her enough!  - Josh Willoughby

No matter my emergency or issue at hand, I got answers quickly. She never turned me away. She never thought any issue was too small or too big. She stayed with me through it all. She talked to me so sweetly and kindly that it calmed me down each day. I had never been through divorce before and this was new to me. She understood that. She showed me how to use every avenue to explore ways to settle but also to make a better case for me. I am so glad I decided to change attorneys in the middle of a case. With her help I was able to find a way to get my child in a better home, better school and afford it all with my alimony and child support.  I am so thankful for her and her staff. name: Antonio Richardson
text: Do not use Steven Eversole out of Birmingham Alabama as an attorney.  I'm warning you he will get your money. My mother lost almost $4,000 from him; in which he promised us some good news for a rule 32 appeal in which he wrote to the States of Alabama  for my brother to get a lesser sentence on his case.

resp.text:
Mr. Richardson, Rule 32's are inherently difficult as you and your family are well aware and were well advised.  They are last ditch efforts after a criminal defendant has been convicted and their appeals denied.  Statistically they have some of the lowest possibility of success in the criminal justice system.  The only thing Eversole Law ever promises anyone is that we will do everything we can to help our clients in any way we can.  And Mr. Richardson, Steven Eversole did not represent your brother, but another attorney in the firm.   You should know that.  Either way,  Mr. Eversole has has great success filing Rule 32 and other post-conviction relief measures for clients, but nothing is ever guaranteed. In 2014 Mr. Eversole himself overturned 287 life sentences and over 2000 years sentence in one case.  In 2013 he overturned a sex crime conviction with life time registration  with an out-of-time Rule 32 Petition in a 26 year old case.  In 2015 Mr. Eversole overturned a several year old drug conviction with another out-of-time Rule 32 Petition.  And again in 2016 Mr. Eversole overturned a 2010, 20 year sentence on a drug trafficking conviction that released our client 15 years earlier on a post conviction relief measure.  And these are just a small accounting of his success. He has won appeals in both criminal and civil matters and been highly successful in both trial and appellate matters in hundreds if not thousands of cases.

Here is just a sampling of Mr. Eversole and the his firm's success: Admitted to practice in All State and Federal Courts in Alabama: •All Alabama State Courts, •Alabama Supreme Court, •Alabama Court of Appeals, •Northern & Middle District of Alabama. Qualifications •Focuses on Criminal Defense and Divorce •Handled thousands of cases •2013, 2014, 2015, 2016 National Top 100 Trial Lawyer •Birmingham Magazine's Top Criminal Lawyer and Top Divorce Lawyer in the same year, 2014 •B-Metro Magazine's Top Lawyer 2016 •B-Metro Magazine's Rising Star 2014 •Newsweek Magazine's Top 14 Criminal Defense Lawyers 2014 •Top 10 Under 40 by the National Academy of Criminal Defense Lawyers •B-Metro Magazine's Face's of Birmingham •AVVO Rate 10/10 •AVVO Top Criminal Lawyer 2015 •AVVO Client Choice Award Winner •Publishes Criminal Defense Blog since 2008 Top Criminal Defense Blog award •Better Business Bureau A+ Rating •Frequent presenter on legal matters •Published several books. Professional & Bar Association Memberships •National Association of Criminal Defense Lawyers •Alabama Association of Criminal Defense Lawyer •National Trial Lawyer's Criminal Trial Lawyer's Association •Birmingham Association •National Organization for Reform of Marijuana Laws(NORML) Legal Committee •National College of DUI Defense •Alabama State Bar •Birmingham Bar Association •Shelby County Bar Association

We are sorry your brother's case didn't work out.  But you don't shoot the messenger when the message is bad.  We wish you and your family all the best in future.  God Bless.

name: Aneesh Chand
text: Highly unethical attorney. We chose Tim since he was  a member of our legal plan to represent us in a civil case. After telling us that the plan would not cover our case, we paid Tim a $2500 retainer. During this time Tim would be proactive and mail us copies of whatever documents he would send or file with the courts. I looked over our legal plan and found that his charges should have, in fact, been covered by our plan.Our legal plan's counse determined that this was so and advised Tim of the same. Since being notified that his time would be covered by the plan and  to not use my retainer for covered charges, I stopped getting any correspondence from his office. No copies of any documents,  no phone calls, no more updates, nothing. Tim never even told us that there was a hearing for summary judgement. The  only reason we found out was from a copy of the order from the  court, itself.  After the hearing, we found out that Tim didn't even argue our case as we had discussed. We eventually lost our case. Tim didn't even bother to notify us until over a week later. When asked about our options, Tim determined that he no longer wanted to represent us and referred us to another attorney who wouldn't even return our calls. When asked about the refund of the $2500 retainer, Tim put us off for over 6 weeks until he finally acknowledged he was trying to "come up" with the money. Our legal plan counsel had also been contacting him to return our retainer without further delay. Throughout this time and during our case Tim would never initiate contact with us. We had to initiate contact with him. Even then, it would take anywhere from a week and a half to a month before he would respond.  Tim eventually decided after 46 days that he was no longer going to refund our money despite knowing that his charges were covered by our plan. I have yet to get a breakdown of how my retainer was spent, much less anything else. I would never refer him to anyone. Now he is running for circuit court judge. If Tim is representative of our judicial and legal system, then we, as citizens, have very little when it comes to faith in our legal system.

text: Overall, not a very good experience at all. This attorney will talk up a good game at the initial consultation, then will subsequently reveal that is not even on your side, which is the very least one ought to expect from a defense attorney. Don't expect him to actually remember anything about your case, because he never takes notes and seems to have terrible comprehension skills. I would describe him as incompetent, but it actually seemed worse than incompetence: he didn't believe me and he was deferring to the prosecutor's (his opponent) side. Though there clearly was some incompetence at play. Mr. Sogol told me that if I got into a pre-trial diversion program that my record would be expunged after completing it. However, I looked it up and the alleged offense for which I was arrested CANNOT be expunged under Alabama law, though I plan to litigate that issue when the time is right. However, he did refer me to legal aid, after the fact I suggested legal aid because it's FREE to receive legal advice. That was by far the best advice he could give me being that Legal aid has helped and guided me through cases before which led me to winning cases on my own, or cases being dropped. If you do not receive the advice you need with any law group(s) I would suggest Legal Aid. Legal Aid response is much quicker. Also, legal aid will listen. I had originally left Mr. Edmiston and his team a RAVE review (even though we did not win). While he did an excellent job in the courtroom ( we didn’t win, but made much progress) his follow through leaves something to be desired.
Since court, the need to file contempt against the other party has arisen on multiple occasions. He has not responded to one phone call or email.
There were also inaccuracies in the order that I asked to be rectified. To rectify these inaccuracies, a petition to alter, amend or vacate must be filed. I now know that it has to be done within a specific amount of time. That time has ran out. I sent several emails explaining the issues and they were never addressed. I have called and spoken to his assistant who always said she will have him call me or she will talk to him or his wife and get back to me....then never does. Now, my family continuously pays for that and will have to seek out alternate defense.
This was not a financial problem either. Mr. Edmiston was paid in full and I would have gladly paid more to have these issues addressed. If he was unable to help, a simple message stating such would have been sufficient.

You do not matter. You are just one of his cases in a stack of cases. He does this without assessing the situation or checking if his staff are doing their job appropriately. After a lengthy conversation I get an apology that his office should have contacted the defendant prior to me contacting them to make sure something was being done. He doesn't keep track of clients cases. He took the case and he couldn't handle it.

He blackmails you into agreeing to terms that Do not meet one standard you have previously set and then makes slight hits that you are going to be out thousands of dollars and pending going to court for years if you don't agree to everything he has laid down. Terms that going in you said you would never agree to and he knew you wouldn't.

Ending his contact with you he says he has done all the work you have paid him for and if you want anything else done you need to pay him a substantial amount of money to do anything.

text:
Hard to find fault with great legal service
The Rose Law Firm successfully wrapped up a contentious divorce for me recently and this is how I'd rate them. Service 10/10 Attorneys Ronilo and Haynes gave me their cell numbers, were always available at ALL hours through phones email or text, answered all my questions quickly and in detail, treated me with respect and always made me feel like my case and family was very important to them. What more can you ask? Price 8/10 I've used other attorneys in the past and shopped around too. The rates here fall about the middle of the range of all attorneys in town. Considering their expertise I feel like they were a bargain as I've found (and used) attorneys who were obviously not as talented or knowledgeable charging double the retainers. Results 10/10 I asked for a lot and they delivered, not much else to say. They came to every hearing, deposition, and finally my trial very prepared and polished. Thankfully they were very aggressive in arguing for me and in moving the case forward or I think the other side would have dragged their feet forever. I'm very happy with how everything turned out. Overall 10/10 I hope to never get divorced again but I would use these ladies if I did. Overall I'm very satisfied. Thank you to everyone who worked on my case.

text: Could not afford these people, I know they are good at what they do but, they wanted 8.000, a child for a custody case. I have 4

resp.text:
Ms. Hall, Thank you for the compliment, I apologize that you were not able to retain our services. That said, I'm afraid there might have been some confusion on the pricing. When I looked at the notes from your free consultation from a little over a year ago, I see there was a quote for two separate cases for $8,000 total.  We don't charge by the child, only by the case and it's complexity, and I apologize that there was somehow confusion in that regard. We always strive to keep our costs competitive and our hourly costs are generally the same or lower (up to 40 percent or more in some cases) than firms with similar experience as us. There will always be someone who will do the job cheaper but that comes at a cost as well. Our attorneys go to specialized family law specific training and only practice family law every day and it does make a difference, especially vs. someone who does little family law, is newer, or does whatever kind of legal work comes along. I wish you well and hope you have been able to get resolution; if you ever want to talk to us about anything our doors are still open.
God bless,
Jennifer Rose

resp.text: I’m so very sorry you were disappointed. Our goal is always to minimize your stress as much as possible by completing cases as quickly, efficiently, and painless as possible under any given circumstance, and though we did try to do just that, I can understand your frustration at the entire situation you were put in to begin with by the opposing party. Unfortunately, as you witnessed, we do occasionally run into an extremely uncooperative opposing party who wants nothing more than to make the process more painful for everyone and who is intent on dragging the process out by any means necessary even if that means making serious allegations that we have to defend the client from. Although I really hated to lose you as a client right at the very end of your case, I’m happy that we were able to take care of almost all necessary litigation for you including depositions, temporary hearings, the entire discovery process, and a settlement conference. I’m glad to hear that someone else was able to pick right up where we left off and take care of the last steps for you in order to finish up your case. We have also been in the position many times wherein we’ve taken over for another attorney and have been able to finish things relatively quickly due to most of the work already having been done, as it was in your particular situation.  Again, I’m very sorry that the process was made so unnecessarily painful for you by the opposing party. That said, if you ever need support, if we can help you in any other way, or you just want to talk about all of this in more detail, please feel free to call us on our cell phones as we’re always more than happy to answer your call. God bless,  Jennifer

resp.text:

name: Jammie Walker
text:
Rose Law Firm only took $$$$, and never made it to court after hiring them for a year. Simple case that should jave been settled in a few months at the longest. They charge for everything, phone calls, reading emails etc. Thousands of dollars one year later we fired them. Oh and did i mention you have to pay in advance or they do Nothing. They did nothing anyway.  I Highly Do Not Recommend this Law Firm.
Run Away Far and Fast!!

resp.text:
Ms. Walker, I'm sorry you're upset. Although you were paying the legal fees for someone else, you were not the client yourself and as such there's a limit to what we were allowed to divulge without express permission from the client. I can say that unless otherwise directed by a client we always seek settlement as a first option to minimize costs and give our client an assured outcome. That said, although we are very proficient at drafting and negotiating settlement proposals, we can't actually force the two sides to agree to them against their will. We do take retainer fees and we do charge for our time which includes things like phone calls and emails; however, these are standard legal fees and discussed upfront with our clients in person and covered in our brief retainer agreement. We are very transparent in the work we do and everything that we bill for.  We work hard to finish our client's cases quickly but some things that are out of our control such as the court's schedule and opposing side's cooperation as well as the details of the case itself can hinder the speed we can complete the job.
God bless,
Jennifer G. Rose

name: Christy
text: Had 3 different attorneys over the time my case was handled by this firm, yet Ms. Rose never spoke to me personally, or set foot in court for me.   The day of my hearing, the attorney forgot all documentation and asked me if i could bring copies from home for him.   If you have a lot of money to waste they will gladly take it.

resp.text: Ms. Jennings, I’m so sorry that you were disappointed; I can understand your frustration. Although we’re all human, I personally would not easily excuse or have faith in any attorney that forgot a file even if it didn’t have any outcome on your final case disposition. I have very high standards for myself and anyone that works for me and I can assure you I would have dealt with this former associate had you made me aware at the time. Regardless, I sincerely apologize. Although forgetting a file was totally out of character for him, I hope you can take some solace in the fact that he is no longer with the firm and has not been for over 5 years.  Although many years have passed since your case, you might recall that I was dealing with a life-threatening medical issue when you hired the firm and was not able to take your case on myself and thus the reason you used my associate at that time.  As far as multiple attorneys are concerned, I assume you are referring to our collaborative approach to law. We often have a primary and second chair attorney on a case working together. While this doesn’t affect the overall cost of your case, the benefits to you can be immense. For instance, though all our attorneys are great we will use each attorney’s greatest strengths to your advantage, so if someone is a better writer or researcher they might be assigned to that portion of your case. In addition, when it comes time to strategize on your case, instead of one attorney coming up with a strategy, you might have three or four working out the best strategy though you will only get billed for the time of one. In effect, you get the knowledge and expertise of multiple full-time family law attorneys for the price of one. This is something most firms can’t offer. I apologize if this process wasn’t clearly explained at the outset of your retaining of the firm. I will make sure that going forward we outline the process in writing to make it easier for clients to understand. name: a google user
text:
I have so many things I can say about this firm with evidence to back it. I will start with not being notified of canceled meetings and court dates. Actually I got a call one time canceling a meeting that I wasn't even told I had. Was informed by the defendant about a court cancelation and then a few days later received the letter from my attorney with a post marked date after my court date. The firm had to postpone my last court date because my attorney had another client that had a case to carry over from the previous week. When I questioned Mrs. Rose about hiring a new attorney and putting her on my case she told me I hired the Rose Law Firm not her.  With invoices showing her reviewing my case and me being charged for it I asked her why there was nobody from the firm there to represent me instead of me having to postpone again and her answer to me was “your case may not have been tried anyways ". You are charged for each email to and from as .10 of an hour unless there is an attachment and then it is .20. If you have a meeting scheduled and they have to cancel then you are charged for them to call and tell you. You are charged for them to park for court. Over a year and a half and all that has been done is cases postponed, deposition, emails, phone calls, 4 or 5 subpoenas, and a temporary order  that had to let my son live with his mother until another court date could be scheduled and I promise people would not believe what  I have paid for this service. Was told I would get a special setting for my case in order to get this done and now have found out the court  date scheduled for 4 months later is not a special setting and will most likely be pushed back further and cost me several thousand more dollars. I could go over the 4000 characters very easily with the way my case has been handled by this firm but if I can save one person from this problem then the $20,000+ will not have been ifor nothing.

PS.....the firm has withdrawn from my case without letting me know and now I am just out those many thousands of dollars and have to start over with a new attorney which proves this firm cares about one thing and it is not your family. MY NEW ATTORNEY HAD THE CASE COMPLETELY FINISHED IN 3 MONTHS!!!!

The letter is just sent to remind you of the rescheduling we talked about in our phone calls and emails prior to the court date, however,  it adds the new date the court has given us so you can put it on your calendar. Hopefully you will give me opportunity to address and clear up any other concerns as client feedback is very important to us.

If going through a divorce, hire Mark before your spouse does!
Thank you Mark!!

name: Amber Wells
text:
I encountered my first instance of needing an attorney dealing with child support and per the google reviews I opted to hire Mr. Gober. As stated in various reviews, Mr. Gober is very straightforward as he advised me on what to expect from the beginning to the end of the process. I was in court for approximately 35 minutes and walked away full of smiles and happiness! I am beyond please with the results produced on my behalf of my daughter and I.
Allyson was amazing as well! My initial phone call with her was very informative and professional as I can recall we spoke for approximately 30 minutes lol!!!
I would like to extend a huge thank you to the both of you!!! (HUGS HUGS & HUGS)

-Many blessings to this business

resp.text: It was more than a pleasure to work with you! Thank you so much for your confidence in us.

name: Kelly Abella
text: I couldn't have picked a better Attorney for my very contentious divorce. Mr. Gober has the perfect blend of qualities for the job. He was smart, insightful and professional. He was appropriately resolute but also able to manage the expectations realistically.  His wonderful sense of humor showed up just when I thought the anxiety would surely overwhelm me. And he assembled a team of the best specialists in the business as we needed them. While a divorce is never a pleasant, it is nice to go into battle with a team you completely trust.

resp.text: You were wonderful to work with, Ms. Abella.  Our senses of humor definitely clicked. Thank you for trusting us with your case.  Representing you has been a pleasure.

name: tink06 Bama
text: Mr Gober consulted with me and had wonderful advise for my situation.  He was very professional and extremely kind.  I will definitely use him in the future if required!

resp.text: Thank you so much!  It was our pleasure. We hope you don’t need us but we are here if you ever do.

name: Amy Simpson
text: Perhaps the thing that impressed me most about Mr. Gober was nothing was "sugar coated". He was very straight forward and told us what to expect each step of the way. Going thru a two year custody/dependency case from start to almost finish Mark has kept us informed of each step and what the options were and what the risks were. There were no empty promises made just to keep the client happy which I know sometimes occurs when seeking counsel. Everything down to his amazing office staff has made this difficult situation easier to navigate. Our family couldn’t not have asked for more than Mark has given. We would give him 10 stars if it was an option!  We will continue to use him for our legal needs ❤️

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words. I give you guys 10 stars as well!

name: Laura Leigh Thompson
text: As a Realtor, I sometimes need legal services for my business, and I receive attorney referral requests from clients. When that happens, I always rely on and recommend Mark Gober. Not only is he an outstanding family law attorney, he specializes in ensuring his clients feel safe and secure in challenging circumstances. I call him “one of the good guys.” Mark is intelligent, knowledgeable and confidently navigates even the most complicated legal scenarios…and he does that while keeping his clients at ease. Mark is also highly respected, and has a ’sterling’ reputation among his colleagues. I don’t use the word ’trust’ lightly. I trust Mark Gober.

text: Not a professional one on one interview.....price is outrageous.

resp.text: Our firm has never represented this gentleman and has no attorney/client relationship with him. His only contact with us was a brief telephone call. Unfortunately, we were unable to accept small weekly payments for representation in a very involved legal matter. We regret that Mr. Jackson was frustrated by financial limitations. Although Mr. Jackson has never received legal services from our office to “rate”, we wish him the best.

name: Christopher A.
text:
Mark and Allyson consistently go above and beyond for their clients. I can attest to this experience firsthand. Mark dealt with my extreme anxiety while I was facing a complex and harrowing situation. While I can be very detail-oriented and laser-focused on worries and what-if's, Mark is in the know, and he's been doing this for a while. He knows exactly what to do, what to say, and (as it is important in small towns such as these) he knows the right people. If you want an attorney who will fight for you and make sure you get the best possible outcome, you can look no further than Mark Gober.
Sorry it sounds cliche, but he really does.
Now where's the 'more than 5 stars' button on this thing....

resp.text: Thank you, Chris. Working with you was our pleasure.

name: kristy patterson
text: Mark did an excellent job of handling my divorce. He kept me informed throughout the process by immediately forwarding to me all court filings as well as written communication between him and the opposing attorney, which greatly reduced my anxiety during the divorce process. I also appreciated his professionalism and the manner in which he dealt with or appropriately ignored petty, exaggerated, or nonexistent issues created by my former spouse and his attorney. name: Steve Hallman
text: We recently had the stressful burden of a child support situation change our lives. Involved in a case that had never been before the Alabama Courts, we had no idea if we should fight or roll over and (pay)dead.  I am far from being a quitter but sometimes you feel that there is nothing or no one that can help you and the ones you care for. Sometimes it seems that the Justice system is anything but just. This is exactly how we felt all the way up to our final hearing. We new we were going to need an intelligent and thorough attorney. We researched and asked people who we should use and was referred to Mark. We went and talked with him and he took our case, but told us he couldn't promise anything. He told us that he would do the best he could, and that was all we could ask for. We just wanted what was fair and felt it was worth the fight. After trying to go to court without an attorney and seeing how that was going we just knew we had to have representation. Our finances were extremely tight and we worried that it might just all be for naught. It seemed the law just didn't have anything to protect us. Mark Gober searched and searched and found cases in several other states that supported our side, and gave us some hope. Still we were concerned that it could go either way. We even were concerned that the truth was not going to come out because everyone kept saying that it was all irrelevant. Even with all of the negative things we were hearing  we stuck it out and kept fighting because we felt that it mattered. We wanted our case to maybe help someone else in the future. Mark surpassed anything that we could have expected when we got in the courtroom for our final hearing. We were amazed by how thorough he was without even having to bring every detail into it (which could have taken a lot more time and cost us a whole lot more money). I could not believe it when he actually got them to admit things on the stand that showed exactly what was going on. Justice was truly done as much as it could possibly be thanks to Mark. This was a case for me of right vs. wrong and the good won out. Thank you so much for all that you have done for our family. You are a wonderful attorney and we will definitely tell everyone we know or talk with how hard you worked for us. You went above and beyond, and we now have faith that the Justice system can work.

resp.text: Thank you so much for those kind words. This was most definitely a case of "right vs. wrong" it was my pleasure to work with you and Jennifer.
